Introduction to the Basics of Protesting

"Congress shall make no law...abridging the freedom of speech...or the right of the people peaceably to assemble, and to petition the Government for a redress of grievances."

â€“The First Amendment to the American Constitution
History of Protesting

History of Protesting

Protesting has been ultilized as a tool to call for social, economic, and political reform. Its definition has evolved over the years, and there are countless ever-so changing ways one can protest. During the American Civil Rights Movement, key historical figures such as Martin Luther King Junior, Rosa Parks, Malcom X, and many more led the fight for racial equality. Their approach to nonviolent protesting and civil disobedience yielded great progress with one of the defining moments being the Civil Rights Act of 1964. This legally ended racial segregation in public spaces and employment discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex or national origin.

Preparing to Protest

Your Rights

Nothing intimidates an insitution more than a civlian who knows their rights.

Clothing and Gear

Dressing for success never rings more true than at a protest. Be one with the water.

Your Role

Choose a role that resonates with you the most. Be prepared to do research beyond the basics provided.

Communication

Wishing for the best also means preparing for the worst. Create an emergency action plan, and learn to communicate effectively

March For Our Lives
The movement calls for stricter gun regulations to be put in place by governments in an attempt to stop gun violence in the United States. These regulations include a license to own a gun, a ban on assault weapons and high-capacity magazines, and closely observing gun lobbies.
Black Lives Matter
The movement calls for the issues brought by systemic racism to be reveresed in an attempt to give back power to the BIPOC community in the United States. These issues include police brutality, the criminal justice system, and economic injustice.
Global Climate Strike
The movement calls for world governments to take more initatives in an attempt to slow down climate change. In addition, the movement advocates for the transition from using non-renewable energy to using renewable energy.
Families Belong Together
The movement calls for an end to family separation and family detention centers in the United States. In addition, the movement aims to spread awareness about the horrible conditions seen in family detention centers.
Transgender Rights Movement
The movement calls for policies that better protect Trans lives to be passed in an attempt to lessen Trans discrimination and Trans violence. These policies are orientated in tackling homelessness, unemployment, and health problems in the United States.
Anti-mask Protestors
This controversial movement calls for local governments to make wearing face masks optional. In addition, many protestors also demand for the right to get a haircut along with other "essential business."

About Me and Contact

In the awake of the Black Lives Matter movement, I was inspired by the activism that took place all throughout the 50 states. Our country was built on protesting, so it was apparent to me that change was on the horizion whether people liked it or not. Due to these recent events, I wanted to contribute to the cause by offering resources for protestors seeking to get informed.
